Text: Cheers for the up kids will be delighted

I just looked at the screenshots and nothing resembles any part of the book upon which this is supposed to be based. I don't remember any kids in it or any people at all come to that.

As far as I remember, The Lorax is a cautionary tale of possible environmental catastrophe caused by greed and stupidity. I suppose there is some dark humour there if you are a Bill Hicks or George Carlin.

I'll give it a watch but I'm dreading it and I bet Ted Geisel is rolling in his grave.

@ K2Smoka: Pretty much all the early release movie files will come in .avi simply because it's smaller and easier to work with. If you want an actual dvd rip you will need to pay attention to the size of the file. Real dvd rips will be about 4.3GB. They have better quality and there's no converting time to burn them but your download time will most likely make up for and go beyond the time it would take you to download a smaller 0.7GB - 1.8GB .avi file and convert it and burn it lol. So my recommendation is stick with the smaller .avi files and use the program convertxtodvd to burn them. Simple and quick. I hope this helps and makes your experience with downloading movies more enjoyable and less confusing.
